title: Your iPhone Is Getting New Emoji Soon — Meet the Characters Arriving in iOS 18.4
description: Get ready to upgrade your emoji game! Thanks to the Unicode 16.0 update, a new wave of fun and expressive characters is coming to your iPhone. While the last emoji refresh was nearly a year ago, iOS 18.4 will bring these fresh designs to your keyboard in spring 2025. The previous emoji update for iPhone arrived in March 2024 with iOS 17.4, adding highlights like the phoenix (🐦‍🔥), lime wedge (🍋‍🟩), and head-shaking faces (🙂‍↔️🙂‍↕️) from Unicode 15.1. This time, the Unicode 16.0 batch, which is available on iOS 18.4 right now as of beta 2, promises a mix of practical icons, playful symbols, and cultural additions to keep your messages vibrant. Don't Miss: iOS 18.4 Has 40+ New Features and Changes for iPhone You Won't Want to Miss Unicode 16.0 introduces seven new emoji characters that represent a variety of emotions, themes, and everyday scenarios. These include Face with Bags Under Eyes, Fingerprint, Harp, Splatter, Root Vegetable, Leafless Tree, and Shovel. An eighth emoji,...more

While the last emoji refresh was nearly a year ago, iOS 18.4 will bring these fresh designs to your keyboard in spring 2025.The previous emoji update for iPhone arrived in March 2024 with iOS 17.4, adding highlights like the phoenix (🐦‍🔥), lime wedge (🍋‍🟩), and head-shaking faces (🙂‍↔️🙂‍↕️) from Unicode 15.1. This time, the Unicode 16.0 batch, which is available on iOS 18.4 right now as of beta 2, promises a mix of practical icons, playful symbols, and cultural additions to keep your messages vibrant.Don't Miss: iOS 18.4 Has 40+ New Features and Changes for iPhone You Won't Want to MissUnicode 16.0 introduces seven new emoji characters that represent a variety of emotions, themes, and everyday scenarios. These include Face with Bags Under Eyes, Fingerprint, Harp, Splatter, Root Vegetable, Leafless Tree, and Shovel. If you can't see the new emoji characters, it's because your device is not yet capable of displaying the new Emoji 16.0 characters. But you can still see what they look like in the image above. Apple devices running iOS 18.4, iPadOS 18.4, and macOS Sequoia 15.4 should be able to display these emoji just fine.Smileys and Emotion (1 total)🫩 Face with Bags Under Eyes: The ultimate emoji for conveying tiredness.People and Body (1 total)🫆 Fingerprint: A versatile symbol for identity, security, or individuality.Animals and Nature (1 total)🪾 Leafless Tree: Perfect for seasonal chats or metaphors about change and growth.Food and Drink (1 total)🫜 Root Vegetable: Representing turnips, radishes, or other root crops.Objects (2 total)🪉 Harp: A musical emoji for conversations about tradition or creativity.🪏 Shovel: From gardening to digging into projects.Symbols (1 total)🫟 Splatter: A bold and abstract purple splat that sparks curiosity and imagination.Flags (1 total)🇨🇶 Flag of Sark: This flag adds a touch of geographic diversity, representing the Channel Island of Sark.If you're not running the latest iOS when these emoji roll out, you might see placeholders or, for Flag of Sark, the grouped regional indicator letters "CQ" instead.The Unicode 16.0 emojis are expected to be adopted by major platforms throughout 2025. These emojis will roll out across Apple devices with iOS 18.4, iPadOS 18.4, and macOS Sequoia 15.4; Android devices with Android 16; Samsung devices with One UI 7; Windows PCs with the 2025 Windows 11 update; and popular platforms like Gmail, ChromeOS, and YouTube following Google's Noto Color Emoji update.There is already speculation about the emoji coming with Unicode 17.0, with characters like Treasure Chest and Trombone. However, following Apple's usual schedule, those emoji likely won't appear on iPhones until spring 2026 with iOS 19.4.Before the upcoming spring 2025 update, which is expected in April, Apple issued new emoji packs to iPhone in iOS 17.4 in March 2024, iOS 16.4 in March 2023, and iOS 15.4 in March 2024.Don't Miss: Revolutionize Your Inbox with iOS 18's Latest Mail Features on Your iPhoneCover photo and screenshots by Gadget Hacks.
html:
Get ready to upgrade your emoji game! Thanks to the Unicode 16.0 update, a new wave of fun and expressive characters is coming to your iPhone. While the last emoji refresh was nearly a year ago, iOS 18.4 will bring these fresh designs to your keyboard in spring 2025.

The previous emoji update for iPhone arrived in March 2024 with iOS 17.4, adding highlights like the phoenix (🐦‍🔥), lime wedge (🍋‍🟩), and head-shaking faces (🙂‍↔️🙂‍↕️) from Unicode 15.1. This time, the Unicode 16.0 batch, which is available on iOS 18.4 right now as of beta 2, promises a mix of practical icons, playful symbols, and cultural additions to keep your messages vibrant.

  • Don't Miss: iOS 18.4 Has 40+ New Features and Changes for iPhone You Won't Want to Miss

Unicode 16.0 introduces seven new emoji characters that represent a variety of emotions, themes, and everyday scenarios. These include Face with Bags Under Eyes, Fingerprint, Harp, Splatter, Root Vegetable, Leafless Tree, and Shovel. An eighth emoji, Flag of Sark, is also included in Emoji 16.0 but not Unicode 16.0 because Unicode no longer accepts flag proposals.

The full lineup and details are below. If you can't see the new emoji characters, it's because your device is not yet capable of displaying the new Emoji 16.0 characters. But you can still see what they look like in the image above. Apple devices running iOS 18.4, iPadOS 18.4, and macOS Sequoia 15.4 should be able to display these emoji just fine.

Smileys and Emotion (1 total)

  • 🫩 Face with Bags Under Eyes: The ultimate emoji for conveying tiredness.

People and Body (1 total)

  • 🫆 Fingerprint: A versatile symbol for identity, security, or individuality.

Animals and Nature (1 total)

  • 🪾 Leafless Tree: Perfect for seasonal chats or metaphors about change and growth.

Food and Drink (1 total)

  • 🫜 Root Vegetable: Representing turnips, radishes, or other root crops.

Objects (2 total)

  • 🪉 Harp: A musical emoji for conversations about tradition or creativity.

  • 🪏 Shovel: From gardening to digging into projects.

Symbols (1 total)

  • 🫟 Splatter: A bold and abstract purple splat that sparks curiosity and imagination.

Flags (1 total)

  • 🇨🇶 Flag of Sark: This flag adds a touch of geographic diversity, representing the Channel Island of Sark.

If you're not running the latest iOS when these emoji roll out, you might see placeholders or, for Flag of Sark, the grouped regional indicator letters "CQ" instead.

The Unicode 16.0 emojis are expected to be adopted by major platforms throughout 2025. These emojis will roll out across Apple devices with iOS 18.4, iPadOS 18.4, and macOS Sequoia 15.4; Android devices with Android 16; Samsung devices with One UI 7; Windows PCs with the 2025 Windows 11 update; and popular platforms like Gmail, ChromeOS, and YouTube following Google's Noto Color Emoji update.

There is already speculation about the emoji coming with Unicode 17.0, with characters like Treasure Chest and Trombone. However, following Apple's usual schedule, those emoji likely won't appear on iPhones until spring 2026 with iOS 19.4.

Before the upcoming spring 2025 update, which is expected in April, Apple issued new emoji packs to iPhone in iOS 17.4 in March 2024, iOS 16.4 in March 2023, and iOS 15.4 in March 2024.

Don't Miss: Revolutionize Your Inbox with iOS 18's Latest Mail Features on Your iPhone

Cover photo and screenshots by Gadget Hacks.
